org.jruyi.core

Interface ITcpConnPoolConfiguration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ITcpClientConfiguration

    public interface ITcpConnPoolConfiguration
extends ITcpClientConfiguration
    This interface defines methods to configure a TCP client of type ConnPool or MuxConnPool.
    Since:
    2.2

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allowsCoreConnectionTimeout()
      Returns whether core connections are allowed to time out.
      ITcpConnPoolConfiguration allowsCoreConnectionTimeout(boolean allowsCoreConnectionTimeout)
      Sets whether core connections should time out or not.
      int corePoolSize()
      Returns the core number of connections.
      ITcpConnPoolConfiguration corePoolSize(int corePoolSize)
      Sets the core number of connections.
      int idleTimeoutInSeconds()
      Returns the timeout in seconds for idle connections.
      ITcpConnPoolConfiguration idleTimeoutInSeconds(int idleTimeoutInSeconds)
      Sets the timeout in seconds for idle connections.
      int maxPoolSize()
      Returns the maximum size of the connection pool.
      ITcpConnPoolConfiguration maxPoolSize(int maxPoolSize)
      Sets the maximum size of the connection pool.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jruyi.core.ITcpClientConfiguration

        apply, connectTimeoutInSeconds, connectTimeoutInSeconds, host, keepAlive, keepAlive, oobInline, oobInline, performancePreferences, performancePreferences, port, readTimeoutInSeconds, readTimeoutInSeconds, recvBufSize, recvBufSize, reuseAddr, reuseAddr, sendBufSize, sendBufSize, soLinger, soLinger, tcpNoDelay, tcpNoDelay, throttle, throttle, trafficClass, trafficClass, unsetPerformancePreferences

    • Method Detail

      • idleTimeoutInSeconds

        int idleTimeoutInSeconds()
        Returns the timeout in seconds for idle connections.
        Returns:
        the idle timeout in seconds

      • idleTimeoutInSeconds

        ITcpConnPoolConfiguration idleTimeoutInSeconds(int idleTimeoutInSeconds)
        Sets the timeout in seconds for idle connections. Sets 0 to not allow idle connections. Sets -1 to never time out.
        Parameters:
        idleTimeoutInSeconds - the idle timeout in seconds to set
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified idleTimeoutInSeconds is less than -1, or if it is -1 but allowsCoreConnectionTimeout is true

      • corePoolSize

        int corePoolSize()
        Returns the core number of connections.
        Returns:
        the core size of the connection pool
        Since:
        2.5

      • corePoolSize

        ITcpConnPoolConfiguration corePoolSize(int corePoolSize)
        Sets the core number of connections.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the new core size
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified corePoolSize is negative
        Since:
        2.5

      • maxPoolSize

        int maxPoolSize()
        Returns the maximum size of the connection pool.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of the connection pool

      • maxPoolSize

        ITcpConnPoolConfiguration maxPoolSize(int maxPoolSize)
        Sets the maximum size of the connection pool.
        Parameters:
        maxPoolSize - the maximum pool size to set
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified maxPoolSize is less than 1

      • allowsCoreConnectionTimeout

        boolean allowsCoreConnectionTimeout()
        Returns whether core connections are allowed to time out.
        Returns:
        true if core connection are allowed to time out, otherwise false
        Since:
        2.5

      • allowsCoreConnectionTimeout

        ITcpConnPoolConfiguration allowsCoreConnectionTimeout(boolean allowsCoreConnectionTimeout)
        Sets whether core connections should time out or not. If true, then core connections will time out when idle for idleTimeoutInSeconds().
        Parameters:
        allowsCoreConnectionTimeout - true if should time out, otherwise false
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given allowsCoreConnectionTimeout is true but the current idleTimeoutInSeconds is -1
        Since:
        2.5
